duties_responsibilities.duty: Administer community and entrepreneur surveys, including survey setup and implementation.
Gather, update, and maintain information regarding the geographical boundaries of Main Street communities from programs across the network.
Assist with the development of data library for internal use and execute basic research tasks in collaboration with department colleagues.
Assemble reports with survey results and other data assets. Assist in developing templates for new research products and communicate research findings through blog posts, infographics, etc.

Contribute to project management tools, including a calendar of projects and task requests. Support the Program Services division with administrative requests. Serve as primary initial point of contact for research requests.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Urban Planning, Public Policy, Public Administration, Economics, Geography, Sociology, Anthropology, or Historic Preservation (Master's preferred)
